reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our main complaint was that he room was very hot (not warm) and they would not turn the air conditioning on because "it was going to get cool" which never happened.
reviews.title: Very hot and no air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tried to leave windows open but there were too many insects, mosquitoes among them coming in.
reviews.title: Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was not very big but clean, comfortable and with charm . This is a problem in a lot of hotels in Spain that won't turn the air conditioning on until mid June.
reviews.title: Nice, but boring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night at this hotel as part of the Cid tour. Modern hotel with spacious, clean rooms & pleasant polite staff. The restaurant was good both for dinner and breakfast. The hotel is a couple of miles outside Teruel however the reception staff directed us to a centrally located carpark. The town is well worth a visit with many interesting historic building & a few good museums.
reviews.title: PARADOR DE TERUEL -- NOT SO BAD
Not Impressed
reviews.text: Spended one night in this hotel, on the way back from Laguardia to avoid to drive 700km in one day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time we stayed in a Parador, we did a small tour in early November.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm writing this with the experience of having stayed in another two within the space of a few days. We enjoyed our stay, the hotel was easy to find and parked right in front. There appeared to be plenty of parking, even if hotel had been more full. Lovely room, with everything we needed (we always carry our own mini kettle with us!). Evening meal was good, breakfast (buffet) was also good with plenty of choice. Staff were not the most effusive but did their job fine. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Not Spains best .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were overnight in this parador as a special treat rather than one our usual hotels. Not special. The parador is located just at the outside edge of town, not one of their old castles refurbished but a modern building. We found the staff unfriendly at best. The room was large as was the bathroom but not really anything unusual. The bed was the most uncomfortable of any hotel bed in all our years of travel.....no sleep even though every blanket to be found was put between mattress and sheet to soften the surface. Would not return based on this experience. One positive thing.....they had the most sumptuous buffet for breakfast ever seen anywhere....included in our booking package....16 euros per person had we paid separately for it.
reviews.title: Nice relaxing Hotel - a bit lacking in character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is clearly a modern Parador which lacks the character of some of the old buildings but you couldn't fault the service. We turned up early and were given drinks vouchers while our room was prepared and we were served with lunch 30 minutes before they said they were open as we were there and they could. Hotel has a lovely pool and tennis courts and is very relaxing. It's by a busy road but there was no road noise to disturb.
reviews.title: A hotel, or a mausoleum?

reviews.text: The town is 3kms walk - it took us about 20 -25 mins to walk right into the centre and the town is lively particularly in the main square. We joined the locals with a coffee on the square and watched the world go by as well as doing the touristy bits which was fun.
reviews.title: A lovely Hotel
